vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_masterCopy != address(0), "Invalid master copy address provided");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(funder.send(payment), "Could not pay safe creation with ether");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(transferToken(paymentToken, funder, payment), "Could not pay safe creation with token");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_masterCopy != address(0), "Invalid master copy address provided");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(funder.send(payment), "Could not pay safe creation with ether");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(transferToken(paymentToken, funder, payment), "Could not pay safe creation with token");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in PayingProxy.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.5.0 (PayingProxy.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.0 (PayingProxy.sol#38): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.0 (PayingProxy.sol#77): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.0 (PayingProxy.sol#105): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: Delegatecall to user-supplied address (SWC 112)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The contract delegates execution to another contract with a user-supplied address.
The smart contract delegates execution to a user-supplied address.This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of this contract account and manipulate the state of the contract account or execute actions on its behalf.
Classification: SWC-112
